question: What type of gambling was Tea Cake particularly fond of?
answer: Tea Cake was particularly fond of dice (rolling dice), though he was also skilled at cards. He describes himself as 'one uh de best gamblers God ever made' who can handle 'Cards or dice either one,' but dice is emphasized throughout the text as his specialty, with him practicing dice all week and later being renowned for 'amazing things with anybody's dice.'
quote: You done married one uh de best gamblers God ever made. Cards or dice either one. Ah can take uh shoe string and win uh tan-yard. Wish yuh could see me rollin'.
